metadata.feature_description: Verifies that the AccountSettings module installs correctly and registers with the DNN/Evoq framework

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify module appears in installed extensions list

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Extensions in PersonaBar
steps.expected: Extensions page loads with list of installed extensions
steps.actual: Extensions page loaded successfully showing Installed Extensions tab

steps.expected: List filters to show only PersonaBar extensions
steps.actual: Filter changed successfully to show Persona Bar extensions

steps.action: Verify Evoq.PersonaBar.AccountSettings is in the list
steps.expected: AccountSettings module appears in the list with version number
steps.actual: Evoq.PersonaBar.AccountSettings version 10.1.1 is visible in the list

steps.action: Click on AccountSettings module to view details
steps.expected: Module details panel opens showing extension information
steps.actual: Details panel opened showing Extension Type: Persona Bar, Name: Evoq.PersonaBar.AccountSettings, Version: 10.01.01

steps.action: Verify extension type is correctly registered

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify assembly is deployed to bin folder

steps.expected: Assembly file exists in bin folder
steps.actual: Found Evoq.PersonaBar.AccountSettings.dll (5632 bytes), Evoq.PersonaBar.AccountSettings.pdb (11776 bytes), and Evoq.PersonaBar.AccountSettings.xml (156 bytes) in C:/DNN/EvoqEngageDoneDev/bin/

steps.expected: Dnn.PersonaBar.UI.dll should exist in bin folder
steps.actual: Dnn.PersonaBar.UI.dll (70656 bytes) found in bin folder along with Dnn.PersonaBar.Library.dll (108032 bytes) and Dnn.PersonaBar.Extensions.dll (4780544 bytes)

steps.expected: Module should be visible in PersonaBar menu
steps.actual: Module appears in PersonaBar sidebar as 'nav_Accounts' indicating it is registered and dependencies are satisfied

steps.action: Check server environment for Azure compatibility
steps.expected: Server information should show compatible environment
steps.actual: Server running on Microsoft Windows NT 10.0.20348.0 with IIS/10.0, .NET Framework 4.8.0, which is Azure-compatible. Module is installed and functioning correctly in this environment.

observations: The AccountSettings module navigation item displays as 'nav_Accounts' in the PersonaBar sidebar instead of a friendly name, suggesting a possible localization resource issue.

No .dnn manifest file was found in the accessible directories for the AccountSettings module. The Azure compatibility flag is typically set in the manifest file during package creation. Since the module is functioning correctly on a Windows Server environment with IIS, it appears to be compatible.
The module's Description field in the extension details is empty.
The code file AccountSettings.html contains placeholder content: 'Hello World, This is Site Settings.' which suggests this may be a shell/placeholder module.
